title: In the future changes of masteries
body:
Can we get rid of 1/2/3/4/5 points systems ?

It's fucking stupid.

99% of the players put either 0 or 5 points. Why are we still using this stupid system ?

replies.body: It's to make it feel like you "gained" something when you level from 0 to 30. Yeah, it's kinda stupid, but there's no real point in changing it now.

I'd still welcome less points for sake of one point = one mastery. Even if then you'd get points only at milestones.

If you could choose from three ordinary masteries per tier per tree how many you want in return of weakening another tier or tree (so you can have all 3 from Resolve, but then you may not have enough points for not even first tier of Ferocity), then option to choose from two major masteries (whereas now you can only choose one of them as it works now), it might bring more "diversity". Let's say you'll have all three masteries from Ferocity Tier I, that's good, nice AS, AD and AP but then either you won't get to Keystone or will not get even one from Resolve, making you squishier than those who'd rather go with just AD/AP amplifier from Ferocity and then other points into Resolve Tier I to fill Tank role.

We'd like to get away from a 30 point mastery system eventually. It was originally done that way so that players leveling up to 30 could be given another option each level. It's meant that the individual significance per point ends up being pretty low though and that new players get penalized. 

Once the new client's out we'll be able to consider doing work to things like Masteries. Until that replaces the old one though we're limited to working within the current Mastery system. That's why Keystone Masteries uses those 5 point stat masteries - we wanted to try more appreciable mastery designs but needed to operate within a 30 point constraint still.

What if....

*wait for it*

_all spells and masteries were available from level 1_


http://i.imgur.com/UmpOi.gif

As for giving people something at each level, why not take a play from the SMITE playbook and give them champion rentals at each level? I know for the 2 weeks that I played SMITE the champion rentals were something that really kept me in the game. I ultimately quit because LoL and it were too similar for me and I like LoL better, but the leveling experience there (partially because of the rentals) was 10x better.

That said, it is nice to hear that a lot of the things we've been griping about are going to be possible with the new client. As an alpha tester I love it so far and im really excited to see all the you can do with it.
Holy sizzle give them champion shards every level. That way they can actually viably collect every champion in less than 4 years (literally how long it took me).

So.

Question.

Why don't you remove the whole "leveling gives you masteries and runes" thing?

I mean, I get the Leveling system, it's so that new players have to spend some time learning the game before they take it to the big leagues, but locking away power from the players who need it the most is kinda dumb.

Haha wow. So you guys seriously developed the new mastery system around the new, under level 30, accounts? You gave us a stupid system all so that the temporary status of being under level 30 would be more significant per level up?

That is....amazingly stupid.

... i guess that Meddler' s reasoning flew over your head. Just for the sake of spending points there wa sdone stuff for leveling until 30. Probably if they could they would have done a single-pojnted mastery for each row, where each one-pointed mastery equals the 5 pointe done. 

If 5 points weren' t enough they would have broke it down to 6,7 or wathever and so on. It' s a simple solution to a simple problem.
Yeah, basically you said nothing. My point is intact. Nice try.
hmm, the voting seems to indicate otherwise.
Pff, yeah, the troll riot fan boys who downvote anyone who questions riot? I take those as a badge of honor

No, youre just an ass, so youre being downvotted.

What was said is that the original mastery system was coded so that it worked under a 30 point cap, and that theyre unable to change the 30 limit currently (im assuming either because of resources or old spaghetti code in the original client when the game was originally developed).

Your point isnt "intact", it failed to grasp what was stated then proceeded to flame just to flame.

Software development isn't that simple. If you throw a ton of people at the system you just end up with a bigger, buggier mess of code.

Speaking of the pre level 30 systems, what if we could link a smurf account to the original to allow it to level up faster given that we already know the game. that way you can police behaviors across multiple accounts and trolls/flamers can't get away with "its just my smurf" because punishments would be shared across all linked accounts.

Or we could make this game like literally any other mmowhatever and just make multi accounting against the rules.

I have yet to hear one legitamite reason to make a smurf account that doesn't boil down to "I want to stomp noobs" or sonething that cannot be accomplished in normals or customs.

I want to play with a low level friend without him having to potentially face a much more advanced player who will pub stomp him. He has a level 10 account and has been playing for 1 week and is still working on being able to move and attack enemies. I've been playing for two years.

while i agree with the linking of accounts would be good, but denying there wouldnt be problems is another thing

ive made a bunch of smurfs, and none of them were to "stomp noobs" in fact it was the opposite..lemme explain alittle

i had an account, still have it, that i started on....needless to say i sucked at first for awhile b4 i learned the game, but this didnt stop people from reporting me. After about 2 months, both me and the friend who introduced me into the game got reported so many times that eventually we got put with people who ONLY spoke spanish....not even an ounce of english.... i was in spanish only games for about 100-150 games b4 i saw my first teammate speaking english.... so (this is when leveling sucked) i got to 30 and figured id try ranked, got 10 afks on my team in my first 8 games (yes an afk in every game except 2 games, in which those games i had TWO afks on my team)....

throughout the next 2 years i spent my time climbing to silver/ almost gold then new season hits and im right back into bronze...i did this about 3 seasons ina row...hell last season i hit gold 2, won 7/10 placements, and bronze 2 again.....

so instead of doing this for 3 years in a row i decided to make a smurf....in under 100 games, with the way MMR works, i was back in gold on this new account...skip a season, i do my placements again and win 8/10 this time....from gold 4 i dropped to b2 again...

this is where i realized why people make smurfs to begin with, its not (100% anyway) to "stomp noobs" but rather a way to climb ezier, remove reports and possibly prisoners island again (riot says its not a thing, but 100-150 str8 games of spanish only speaking people tends to make me think otherwise....+ the fact of the afks etc)

but bottom line is this, with a new account you get to climb easier, remove reports, climb faster, and dodge prisoners island

btw, within 3 months (of playing mostly bot only games aka not practicing on people) my rank went from b2-b1 area to gold 5....nothing changed besides my accounts, and to this day that main account (that i always go back to bc i have all champs runes etc) still cant climb worth of crap but yet i hop on my other account and its a night and day difference (i have about 8 smurfs now)..


the way MMR and your ranks reset every season pretty much says if ur not plat, your gonna have to do it all again from the bottom and honestly some of us dont want to do that climb again when we can play 100 games and get 3 leagues higher rather than play out an account that imo has the cards stacked against it.... kinda falls under the same boat as how it detects smurfs but the beginning changes  the possible later outcome by alot or at least more than triples the amount of games to get there

main/original account? silver 5 atm (for last months since preseason and was gold2 the time of reset)
where as ive gotten 2 other accounts to gold5/4 in under 100 games....

so choice is yours, would u rather play 3000 games to get to gold? or would u rather play under 100?
thats my reason for smurfing, and with smurf detection systems you HAVE to play only bot games to level account and you have to not farm as well as you normally do otherwise it will detect you being a smurf and make you opponents harder....

ive got gold 5 out of placements on one account and silver 1 right out the gate on another....if u wanna fix this problem with smurfs u better start with MMR and how u get thrown into silver-gold games right in your placements....the way a ladder works is you start from the bottom and climb....imagine how much harder it is to climb when new people trying to climb the ladder constantly keep starting 1-2 rungs above you...

while i agree with you, i also have to disagree as long as this is happening.....but a far as linking accounts im 100% for that, people should be punished and if you can just up and make a new account...thats not really something to be feared... Sorry for the wall of text but i found it needed for you to understand why i think this way to begin with
I guess I can understand this, but it still makes a shitty experience for others. Too bad you can't like... Buy an MMR reset or something

If I may suggest...

I know the second part of that level progression is also that throwing the mastery system at players before they know enough of the game to make informed choices.

I would like to see "Recommended" mastery builds available for every champion to give a start point for anyone playing the champion for the first time AND allowing players to have that power without overwelming them with the system.

It is just until level 10 you have the recommended build active, after that you have the choice to interact with the WHOLE 30 point system but unless they seek to create a mastery page the recommended build stays in effect.

Like the first option on the drop down for mastery in the UI could be "Champion prebuilt" or something.

I would also like to see the rune system nuked but that is more foundational to league and harder to purge.

do you plan reworking each tree? if yes, do you think about increasing power on resolve tree, as defence masteries were heavily nerfed comparing them to previous seasons? that created a problem of too high base damages for example, as full tanks still did enormous amounts of damage (prime example - ekko) and overall dealing too much damage with barely any items

You should just revert the mastery system to what it was before the update; I felt like there was much more control over what bonuses you could select when they were more granular, but this new system basically dumbs down the entire system from 30 points to 10 points.

Um...are you serious right now?
I say you guys REMOVE scaling runes and beef up masteries to scale appropriately with the leveling phase in game.
I mean...cmon...
Ability power, Armor Penetration, Oppressor, Frevor, Thunderlord's Decree, etc. all have significant burst damage EARLY GAME...late game, you can't even FEEL/SEE them doing anything worthwhile.

You would think that with an assassin build on say Sivir would see that 7% stack with {{item:3147}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3134}} and other items...but it seriously doesn't feel like it at all.  It honestly feels like that 7% is actually 0.7%...and that's a little redundant...especially since assassin's and ADC's should be able to effectively PEEL the enemy tank and ADC down to literally nothing...its irrelevant.

In one of my matches, I went up against a FULL TANK garen, using armor penetration WITH {{item:3153}} and {{item:3031}}...takes like 30 hits to DROP him!  Facing him alone whereas other masteries damage should stack, and oppressor should have kicked in since he WAS disabled...but the ED at 2.5% doesn't even show up, even in beginning/early-laning.

Care to...elaborate on why this is?

mathematically, being tankier makes you better in a 1v1 until you have lifesteal, then going damage wins out.

If you had {{item:3153}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3036}} you would kill Garen and take 0 damage, basically.

That's my usual build...
But I replace berserk for Ninja...and until I have enough gold for thrister, I keep static handy for cs and team pokes.

Ninja is fine, and if you were playing properly, you'd kill Garen and take 0 damage on basically any ADC except Caitlyn with that build. Remember that the game is not designed to be easy, so if you fail to do so, there's an easy solution.
Runes should be removed since they are a grinding gate to gameplay. However, the removal of runes, or making them free, would cause the entire community to implode so they'll never do jt
to give the illusion that you can have your own custom tree.

wait so... why not just update it, so the first 10 levels give you free masteries, and the next 20 levels give you free runes. oh, and delete tier 1 and 2 runes while you're at it.

yeah. levels 1-10 unlock one of ten mastery points, and each level costs 1 point. level 11-19 gives you either 3 of the small runes or 1 quint, and level 20 unlocks a second page. levels 21-29 give you some more free runes, and level 30 gives you a free ward skin and a "rune page discount token" that lets you unlock a third rune page for 90% discount.
Riot would rather force you to grind for it to incentivize you to spend money. Riot cares about your money, not your feelings

The 5pt system in the masteries is a bit clunky, but any immediate solutions would simply raise more issues and it honestly isn't a large enough problem for Riot to worry about it atm

they already lowered the cost of AD marks, armor yellows, mr blues, attack speed quints, for a typical ad page. and mpen reds, health per level yellows, ap blues, and ap quints for a typical AP page. 

if they "unlocked" these two pages one level at a time, then that would do a really good job of introducing players to runes. getting a few rune slots AND runes to put in them would really help introduce the concept of runes and how they work. and of course, this would be 2 levels short, so there could be some kind of like, skin promotion, or hextech promotion, or something going on. maybe 3 health per level yellows and 3 ap blues are given on level 29 to get players interested in buying more runes, since riot IS a company that wants their players to use the store afterall, and similarly level 30 an AD quint is given with that ward skin I mentioned. yeah! that sounds like a complete level plan!

It would be weird though for people leveling up. Having mile stone masteries works for a game like WoW as an example, because you are supposed to be out in the world questing / doing pve. You have to opt into pvp.

LoL is balanced around being only pvp. It would feel like garbage if you were new to the game, hoping for a competitive experience, and found out you lost your lane cause your opponent was a level higher than you and had access to a cery important mastery that you didn't. 

This can currently happen, but those gaps in power are much smaller than what they would be if we set it to milestone levels.

Why not just unlock all masteries at the start, or in the first 10 lvls or so?  Right now it feels really bad if you are below lvl 18 and go against someone with a keystone.  Imagine playing mid with no runes as a lvl 17 summoner (so new keystone either) and laning against a leblanc (lvl 20) with a tier 3 rune page and thunderlords.   She would be able to burst so much harder than you can.  

The tiny benefits from each rank in the 5 point masteries don't make up for lack of keystones.

One rune slot per lvl is enough of a progression bonus.

I'd be fine with that as well. I was mostly responding to the idea that there should be mile stones for masteries. I didn't respond to the actual person posting that thought though because I'm a moron.

Better yet, make masteries all available at level one. Why do we have this system where it adds stats and game-changing buffs to any champion, but not usable until you've played SOOOO many games? Every time I try to bring a friend into League, they get turned off by one of these things: not having access to important masteries, not having runes that they need for any given champion, and not having all the champions unlocked. 

Maybe it sounds a bit greedy to want all those things, but especially if you've played dota2 before League (wherein all the playable heroes are unlocked when you start) it feels really restricting to have just a few at a time. Playing a game where you don't have the same masteries or as many runes as your counterpart on the enemy team feels really bad as well. These aspects of the game are extremely unfun for new players; absolutely everyone I've invited to play say they'd play more if not for these limitations.
Riot doesn't want you to have fun, they want you to give them your money.
i'd like it if i could have 30/0/0 pages again :<... (yeah i was that guy)
It's for the math nerds, I imagine the optimal masteries are generally 2 - 3 or 1 - 4 distributions (like on Dopa's TF) but ain't nobody got time for that.
The optimal masteries are actually almost always 0-5. If one is better than the other for a champion, then there's usually no point in diversifying.

On certain mixed bags (primarily hybrid scalers with strong combos), both burst and sustain is the right answer. For them, it won't end up mattering if you have 1.2, 1.6 or 2% LS|SV but they'll still want some for when they eat up a huge wave or they're running away while casting their abilities to peel. Conversely, as I said, their abilities are powerful by themselves but they'll still want to scale them up as much as they reasonably can.

tl;dr: I disagree.

If you're going to need healing, you want it to be as much as possible, where items are to be considered more efficient for damage than masteries and masteries more efficient for LS/SV than items. Anything short of 5-0 should be "not enough", and the damage boost, not having all of its points, would be minor anyway.

We're kind of splitting hairs here, but anything short of 0-5 is suboptimal. This doesn't just apply to League, but most games, particularly RPGs with a variety of enemies. We could specifically calculate, for example, how much AP at level X with X items and X runes Veigar needs to burst down a Vayne with X items, X runes and X masteries, but that's a pointless analysis imo because of how things can so easily go another way. Therefore, masteries are best when put to extremes, to deal with any situation.

For the mixed bags, If you want a combo able to finish off targets, you'd invest fully in damage, and if you want healing, you'd invest fully in LF/SV. Trying to get the best of both worlds puts them at a disadvantage both when the optimal mastery is needed and when it isn't. (Not enough points on the mastery that would be better) Masteries (mainly non-keystones) don't hold the same power as items, So barring pure unbridled luck, (getting away with 1 hp, etc.) they can't be used to make a big difference in anything but a champion's primary output.

Maybe I'm not wording this well. Here's another example:

Let's say Veigar does 1000 damage with his ult. with 1% spellvamp, he can heal 10 health.
On the other hand, let's pretend the other mastery increases that damage by 1%, and that he can do an extra 10 damage.

Obviously, Veigar selects the damage. Every champion should be picking one or the other, because they want one or the other more.

There are no doubt champions that will want both, but then the same could be argued about Veigar. Even if Veigar builds a rod of ages, he would bother with it if it didn't provide great AP. If you could convert the 500 health into an additional 100 AP, Rod of Ages would suddenly be a hilariously broken item. Even if it only converted into 50 AP, it would render Morellonomicon obsolete for all but the most cdr-desperate mages, who would probably rather just build both items anyway.

Every champion in the game wants one stat or the other more. There are many champions in the game that will want both, but that's what items are for. One will always be more optimal, and balance out what items provide, thus making it better to go 5-0 in them. Maybe if there were an almost perfect balance between damage and healing already available with items, one could go 2-3 or 1-4 to make the balance perfect, but I don't think such a balance even exists. To even be called perfect, we need to base it off that same Vayne with X items, X runes and X masteries. As I said before, masteries are meant to plan for any situation, so we need to take what the champion will generally need more of and crank it up to 11. Otherwise, there's no point in bothering.

Let's say Veigar needs exactly 1000 mana for anything he would need.

Items can provide 800 or 1300 and masteries can provide up to 100

You would either take 900 mana with the items and masteries or 1300 and focus masteries elsewhere.

Items and masteries are too imprecise to allow Veigar to ever get around 1000 mana.

(Thank you for putting so much thought and effort into your reply, I always appreciate that)

But here's the thing though, say you've got a champion with a low health pool but relative safety thanks to range, mobility and/or innate power. Like I said in the beginning, I only have Dopa's TF as a reliable source for that it works. Still, it makes sense, TF is more about good positioning and constantly smacking people with his cards than OSing people with one combo... but he doesn't usually build for sustained damage either (such a playstyle would encourage that). So why not calculate if he wants .4%|.8%|1.2%|1.6%|2% of the 2-3k minion waves in addition to the 1k damage to champions, 20 health from feast and his health regen? It's not like he'll get to full health with it anyway.

You're right though that for certain champions, that isn't an option. They'll focus on either maximum survival or maximum burst with no room for calculations. After all, that little bit of extra damage or sustain will add up over the course of the game particularly for a champion that specializes in either.
Don't worry, I don't see the point either {{champion:64}}
